intro: Ossaea lanceolata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf ossaea, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Ossaea lanceolata thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
